alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eastern San Miguel County; Estancia Valley; Harding County; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 10:31PM MST until January 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations ranging from 1 to 4 inches. Parts of San Miguel and Harding counties will see between 3 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Estancia Valley, Lower Rio Grande Valley, Upper Tularosa Valley, Eastern San Miguel County, Harding County, Northeast Highlands, and Chaves County Plains. * WHEN...Until Noon MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eastern San Miguel County; Estancia Valley; Harding County; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Upper Tularosa Valley
